item.title: Flytipping,, 15th July
item.description:
There is regular flytipping by this tree of big commercial looking waste like pallets and industrial fridges. This location needs a camera to catch flytippers at this corner.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 70, Bagshot Street, Old Kent Road, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Bins are not being collected, 15th July
item.description:
2 & 3 Glebe Road: a constant problem of bins not being picked up. Rubbish and dog/human poo everywhere. This is not a dumping ground.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Glebe Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Pieces of wood flytiped on street, 15th July
item.description:
Hi. There has been a pile of wood on the pavement for several weeks now. It gets moved around daily and is often scattered across the pavement, not great for those with pushchairs and mobility aids or wheelchairs. Please can it be removed. Thanks.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Oakfield Road, Anerley, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dead fox, 15th July
item.description:
There is a dead fox next to the entrance of Cossall Park in the emergency service entrance to 2 Woods Road opposite John Donne Primary School.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Wood's Road, Peckham, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Two plastic containers on the floor below bin, which seems to contain car oilà, 15th July
item.description:
This bin is constantly used innapproprtatly. Last night 14/07 or early this morning there are two plastic containers which appear to contain used car oil placed below the bin on the pavement. Whoever has placed them there must know of the dangers to inquisitive children, animals and the environment.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Salisbury Road, Southborough, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Flytiped rugs and underlay, 15th July
item.description:
There is a flytiped rug next to the green electricity box and a pile of rolled up carpet underlay flytiped on Oakfield Road. Please can these be removed. They have both been there for several days. Near Flats 27 and 28. Thanks.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Oakfield Road, Anerley, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Littering, 15th July
item.description:

item.title: Burning Smell Once Again, 15th July
item.description:
Burning plastic smell happening again somewhere between Follingham Court and Kingsland Road. Seems to be happening every Tuesday now between 7-9pm (Used to be on Mondays before) Someone is clearly burning rubbish and it’s going into all of that east block
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Kingsland Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Pavement tree outside number 49 Cavendish Road, 15th July
item.description:
The Pavement tree outside number 49 Cavendish road is massively overgrown. It's taken up much of the pavement, making it difficult for people to walk. Also causing issues when I'm reversing the car out of the driveway as I cannot see any of the incoming traffic.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Cavendish Road, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Broken Bus Shelter glass, 15th July
item.description:
The bus stop glass has been shattered and must have happened this week. Glass everywhere and can harm children or animals. The nearby BT phone booth has also been damaged

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Paxton Green Roundabout, London
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Damage - smashed glass or panels / jagged metal edges on shelter
